channel.title: Homes on Wisconsin Weed Science

item.title: **WiscWeeds**
item.description: Wisconsin Cropping Systems Weed Science Program Weed Science Knowledge to Academics and Practitioners University of Wisconsin-Madison

item.title: About Us
item.description:
Our Research and Extension Program (WiscWeeds) at the University of Wisconsin-Madison focuses on agroecologically-based approaches to address sustainable weed management in corn, soybeans and small grains in Wisconsin and beyond. Our program also focuses on weed management strategies that can help address herbicide resistance, protect water quality, enhance agroecosystems services and increase food security.
2019 WiscWeeds Team

item.title: Team
item.description:
Rodrigo Werle (PI: Assistant Professor & Extension Weed Scientist)
Ryan DeWerff (Weed Science Research Specialist)
Nick Arneson (Weed Science Outreach Specialist)
Maxwel Coura Oliveira (Weed Science Postdoctoral Research Associate)
Dan Smith (UW-NPM Southwest Wisconsin Regional Agronomy Specialist)
Sarah Striegel (MS Weed Science Graduate Student)
Nikola Arsenijevic (MS Weed Science Graduate Student)
Victor Ribeiro (Visiting MS Weed Science Graduate Student)
Felipe Faleco (MS Weed Science Graduate Student)

Rodrigo Werle is an Assistant Professor and Extension Cropping Systems Weed Scientist in the Agronomy Department at UW-Madison. His research and extension program (WiscWeeds) focuses on agroecologically-based approaches to address sustainable weed management in corn, soybeans and small grains in Wisconsin and beyond. The program also focuses on weed management strategies that can help address herbicide resistance, protect water quality, enhance agroecosystems services and increase food security. Rodrigo was born in a small farming community of Dutch immigrants in the state of SÃ£o Paulo, in southeastern Brazil.
